intro: Alopecurus phalaroides, commonly known as the meadow foxtail, is a flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant has slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces fluffy, feathery seed heads that resemble a fox’s tail. Its small, wind-pollinated flowers are clustered in dense spikes, and it is often found in temperate regions across Europe, Asia, and North America. Alopecurus phalaroides plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
